intro: Kuhlmanniodendron, commonly known as the African sandalwood, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Fabaceae. It consists of a single species, Kuhlmanniodendron gharariense, native to the dry savannas of southern Africa. The plant is characterized by its small, deciduous leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found growing in sandy or rocky soils, adapting well to arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
